sentences: During the morning informal consultations and contact group, parties considered revised draft text on the report of the Adaptation Fund Board and review of the Adaptation Fund.
During the informal consultations, many parties supported the revised text with minor amendments.
On the report of the Adaptation Fund Board, differences remained on proposed workshops on accreditation of national implementing entities.
Some parties opposed reference to workshops.

Others noted, however, that, according to the text, the workshops must be subject to the availability of funds and prior consultation with the Board, thereby ensuring that the workshops would only be held at the appropriate moment.

Subsequently in the contact group, the PHILIPPINES regretted that after a year of negotiations on the issue, agreement had not been reached, while the EU noted that the proposal on holding workshops was recently introduced.

Discussions will continue. COMPLIANCE (COP/MOP): During informal consultations in the morning, parties continued considering Croatia s appeal against a decision by the Enforcement Branch of the Compliance Committee.
Discussions focused on a draft COP/MOP decision proposed by the co-chairs.
Parties also addressed a new suggestion by a party on the amendment of the Kyoto Protocol relating to compliance.
